revised_title: Chemical Relaxation as a Transport Process: A Microscopic Approach
tldr: This article explores the relationship between the relaxation time and the intermolecular potential of reacting species in chemical reactions. It focuses on the temperature jump method as a typical case of a transient method and discusses the computation of relaxation time and ultrasonic absorption and dispersion. The study connects the macroscopic rate constant to the microscopic cross-section for the reacting process, providing a better understanding of chemical reactions and their rate constants.
